title: Biblical Meditation - The Key to Success
theme: Meditation as the Most Critical Spiritual Discipline
scripture: Joshua 1:8, Psalm 119:11, Romans 12:2, Romans 8:6, Philippians 4:6-8, Proverbs 4:20-22
summary: Based on Bishop Johnson's powerful sermon on biblical meditation. Includes 12 prayer points organized by 6 major themes: committing to meditation, moving Word from head to heart, exchanging worry for peace, meditation as prayer/worship, spiritual success, and practical application.
keyPoints: Obedience to God's command to meditate
Meditating on things that are praiseworthy
Prosperity and success in God's assignment
Grace to be a doer of the Word
Sustained focus and soaking in the Word
Using imagination to see yourself walking in truth
actionSteps: Memorize Joshua 1:8 this week
Set aside 15-30 minutes daily for meditation on Scripture
Choose one verse to meditate on for an entire week
Practice the 4 R's: Read, Review, Rehearse, Repeat
Replace worry time with meditation time
Visualize yourself walking in the truth you're meditating on
Journal what God reveals during meditation times

title: The Secret of Victory Over Sin, Satan And Self
summary: Based on Bishop Johnson's powerful sermon revealing that victory over sin, Satan, and self is not achieved through willpower but through understanding and believing our spiritual reality in Christ. Includes 10 prayer points covering union with Christ, being dead to sin, alive to God, and the four steps to victory.
keyPoints: Knowledge: the first step to victory
Present yourself as an instrument of righteousness
Victory over Satan and spiritual enemies
Victory over self and walking in newness of life
actionSteps: Memorize Romans 6:11
Declare daily: 'I am dead to sin and alive to God'
Study Romans 6 and understand your union with Christ
Refuse to let sin reign in your mortal body
Present yourself to God as an instrument of righteousness
Speak truth to yourself based on God's Word
Walk in the reality of your new identity in Christ

title: Three Treasures of Justification
theme: Peace with God, Access to Grace, and Hope That Does Not Disappoint
summary: Comprehensive prayer points based on Bishop Johnson's sermon on justification. Includes 7 specific prayers covering the three treasures of justification, practical applications, and bold witness.
actionSteps: Memorize Romans 5:1-5
Read one Bible passage daily on justification
Share the gospel with one person this week
Write a testimony about what justification means
Pray for someone struggling with guilt
Thank God for His righteousness given to you
Study the doctrine of justification deeper

title: The Gospel of Grace - Peace with God
theme: Peace with God Through Jesus Christ
summary: Based on the powerful sermon about Jesus as the Peace Child who legally secured our peace with God. Includes 8 prayer points covering our legal standing, God being FOR us, transformation through grace, and evangelistic passion.
keyPoints: God is FOR us, not against us
Treated as though we never left home
Nothing can separate us from God's love
actionSteps: Memorize Romans 5:1-2
Share the Peace Child illustration
Declare 'It is God who justifies!' when condemned
Thank God daily that He treats you as He treats Jesus
Allow grace to teach you to say 'no' to ungodly habits
